I was being pursued by someone in a vehicle trying to run me down. Being in an orchard, I was able to duck behind whatever tree was nearby. Then I found myself far from any tree trunk, but I managed to leap up, grab a branch, and pull myself to safety. However, the driver skidded the vehicle to a stop and aimed a pistol at me. The click I heard which wakened me came from an alarm clock. My heart was racing when I awoke.
After my second child was born, I had watched A Nightmare on Elm Street 3. That very night, Freddie was in my apartment coming for me and my children. To this day, I no longer watch horror films.

being chased in and around train cars, box cars and oil tankers. I never get caught and I never get away. I don't know why I'm being chased. It's always at night and dark. No one else is involved. I don't really feel afraid or threatened but I'm running anyway.

The scariest nightmares I ever had were when I was a teenager. I don't remember why I was afraid, but there was darkness all around. I was terrified, knew I was asleep, and wanted to wake up. I could not wake myself up so I would try to call out so someone else would come and wake me up, but I couldn't get any sound to come out.
I cannot remember any specific ones, but they all involve falling of one kind or another - and they usually wake me up. I am afraid of heights.

I was in a hospital waiting to be executed. I could see the firing squad outside my window. I was executed (did not visualize) and reincarnated. I was explaining this to the church congregation when a frightening wind swept through the church. I knew it was the Holy Spirit telling me that I should not be talking about reincarnation because I'm a Christian.
I must have been very young. I just remember a toy dog I had and liked being as tall as a building, and it scared me. That's all I recall, but this too recurred some.

From college -- a fire escape (which did not exist from my dorm room) that I needed to go down, for an unknown reason to escape an unknown threat; I needed my father to help me, but for some reason, in the dream, he was unable to. When I woke up from it, I had to call home to make sure my dad was okay.
my then husband, was holding something in his hands and i couldn't see what it was, and it scared me and i woke up screaming.

I dreamed that my Mother had died, while she was still alive, I sat up in bed and screamed for her. The dream was so real that I called her in the middle of the night to make sure whe was okay. Scared her when she found out why I called.
When I was young, I dreamt about a square somehow fitting perfectly into a circle. Very bizarre to think about it but I remembered whatever was going on scared me.
I was falling off a cliff and would wake up terrified. This was when I was about 8 years old.
My brother was dead and somehow I was at fault. I was about 10 yr. old and I was very frightened and told my mother. I even saw him in a casket.

When young, I had seen the movie, The Spiral Staircase (1940s). this movie scared me and I dreamed about scenes from this movie for years. Someone who wanted to kill me was hiding in the closet. I knew the man was there and could not get out of the room. One eye of the man was visible in the dark of the closet and I would awaken in great fear. To this day (I am 68 I will not go to sleep in any room without checking for someone in the closet.
Flying so high up looking down on the earth/town while standing on a little piece of wood...like a shingle size and holding on to a rope, scared to death I would fall.

As a child I thought I'd awakened but I was still asleep. I looked over at my favorite stuffed toy, 'sleepy dog', so named because he had eyes that were sewn on half moons resembling closed eyes. His eyes were open and he was staring at me. I was so terrified I would not even LOOK at 'sleepy dog' ever again.

Right after my aunt died when I was ten I had a dream that I couldn't find my mother anywhere. In the dream I was overcome with such a physical feeling of dread and lonliness that I became frantic, looking for her, knowing that I would find her dead like my aunt. In the dream I did find her dead and that woke me up. Terrified, I went running for my mother who was, of course, quite alive, but both the image of her dead and the physical feeling haunted me for years.

I am being chased down a dark street by a mugger who is going to kill me. No one will find me for days. I do not see a face, only a threatening presence. I begin running. I have asthma so breathing becomes more and more difficult until I awaken.
I do remember having several dreams (which I no longer remember), that when I woke, I was so glad and I was afraid to go back to sleep in case it continued.

Not so much anything where I was afraid, but in which I was shot tyring to protect a family member. I would instantly realize this was a dream and try to work my way out of "dying", to continue the dream. But most of the time I wake up.

The worst nightmare I can remember took place when I was 10-11 years old. I was walking in the woods at night and came upon a very old abandoned and wrecked car. It was hard to see, but I recognized an old woman that I knew. She was dead and rotting away. Suddenly, she began to move and looked at me very threateningly. I began to run away from the car when I turned around and saw her coming after me. I could not run or scream and felt terrified. I woke up.

A friend from the neighborhood used to like to have grasshoppers as pets. This freaked me out, and I had a nightmare where she came to the front door covered from head to toe with grasshoppers. I haven't been comfortable around them since and still have some irrational fear of them.
I used to have a recurring nightmare about being forced to accompany people who were killing other people and I had to witness it. It was very frightening.

A ghost or a evil spirit had me up off the ground and pinned against my bedroom window. I was pushing against the window with my hands and trying to push my head away from the window, but niether one would move. I was so scared I woke myself up. Then I realize I had fallen asleep the my hands behind my head and with my fingers interlocked. So my hands was pushing against my head and thats way i could not move in my dream. Then I started laughing because I realized there was nothing to fear.
The one about a fear of the unknown shape was a recurring childhood dream and was to this day the most terrifying.

I remember looking out of my sliding glass door and seeing a mountain in the distance, that had not been there ever. It was a volcano and everytime I tried to tell someone about it they just ignored me. Every time I would take another glance out of the window, the volcano seemed to be closer. I was really scared.

I USED TO DREAM MY CHILDREN & I WERE AT MY PARENTS FARM IN MI & I WAS AWAY FROM THE HOME THE CHILDREN WERE INSIDE THE HOME WATCHING TV & I SPOTTED A TORNADE COMING OUR WAY THERE WAS NO WAY I COULD GET TO IT IT WAS DROPPING LOWER & LOWER & I NEVER KNEW THE OUTCOME AS I'D WAKE UP & IT TOOK ME A WHILE TO GET THAT TERRIBLE DREAM OUT OF MY HEAD THAT IS A RECURRING DREAM I DREAD...
Being accused of a crime I didn't commit and being pursued doggedly (like the Fugitive). Very graphic and frightening, can't recall specifics.

When I was young I had a recurring nightmare which involved people trying to make me lay down in a hospital. I would try and try to run away but I could only move in slow motion. I knew that if the people got me to lay down on the hospital bed I would die. I was terrified! Then I would wake up and feel safe. After that I realized that I was actually still asleep and the people were still there trying to trick me into laying down. This would happen several times before I would actually wake up.
I dreamt my son was killed in a car accident as a teen - and I was so afraid it would come true. I was very glad he made it safely to 20 and I could stop worrying so much

I dreamt I was ina NYC and there was a huge explosion and people were running everywhere to hide away from the debris in the air, I hid with some men in suits in a lobby . There was generalized panic. Then I went to a small place in the country and there was also an explosion and I hid by a running stream
Woke up at age of 5 or 6, frightened about "the black sun" -- whatever the hell that was. Could be from a sci-fi TV program I'd watched earlier.
My nightmares have been somewhat filled with some anxiety or fear but not in a terrible manner. Very few times I woke up.

I was living in an old house, and found a way up to the attic, which was inexplicably HUGE, dark, and full of frightening things. Can't describe them now, but it was disturbing. Had the same dream over a period of time. Would have made a great horror movie.
The worst nightmares I recall involve being under threar of danger, and being unable to move.

I dreamed that aliens had emerged from wall by my bed and we dragging me away, back with them. I woke shaking with fear and silently screaming. It was weeks before I was free of the dread and shock. Even tho this dream occurred nearly 15 years ago, I can still feel the shock and horror of it.

When my youngest son was a teenager I dreamed that he was on a very high building that was under construction. He was walking backward toward a precipice. I was terrified. He was having problems at the time and the dream convinced me that I had to do something to help him.
Large, Chineese New Year like faces with threating looks floating in the air or on dragon-like bodies.
I can remember falling.........probably why I'm afraid of heights today. Also remember being in a scary house......and always the same house....over and over.

I was in a street by the American Embassy in Havana, Cuba, and thee were crocodiles all over the street. They were just there, playing like little puppies but they scared me because of their big jaws.
The worst I believe would be when I had a fear of the loss of someone dear, either they were leaving or had gotten lost themselves, I would search for them in a wide variety of areas of the world.
That I have murdered someone and gotten away with it, but afraid that someone would eventually find out.

The light is too bright for my eyes, there's an overwhelming feeling of dread, urgency and panic - but I can barely keep my eyes open. There's something I must do but I am struggling to see and it's gets more and more painful to do so.

When I was very, very young, I remember having a dream where I was listening to some popular, minor-key 80s new wave song. It had a slow tempo. I don't remember which song it was, but I was in some futuristic place and there was a hologram talking to me, it was my father telling me he was going away forever. I was crushed and horribly afraid of that, even in my waking life as a child. No nightmares that I have now compare with that one, no matter how bad they are.
Being chased by an unknown fear resulting in night terrors
My mother had an old record of a song called Dangerous Dan McGrew, and I visualized him with a trench coat and a large floppy hat chasing me all over outside somewhere unknown.
Being chased down the street behind my elem. school. running in slow motion from unseen dangerous person.
Falling, falling, falling -- and being terrified. That's all I remember of it.

I was standing at the top of our stairs. The dream is in fuzzy red and white (like a TV going out of reception. I put my hand flat on the wall and the other on the railing and start doing turns upside-down like a somersault but I do not fall. I am afraid, but I keep doing it anyways.

Running through fluffy pink clouds but unable to get any traction or make any progress. Then I was confronted by something that threatened me. I would punch it but my fists just sunk in, having no effect.
I incorporated an alarm clock into a dream that the world was ending.

I had a recurring nightmare that all the people in the apartment complex my mother and I lived in were chasing me with various weapons and trying to kill me. Eventually I got to where (mid-dream) I knew it was only a dream and that the people chasing me couldn't really hurt me, but I got scared every single time and began running again.

When I was about 10, I had a dream set in Biblical times. There were Roman soldiers in view and the dream had the feel of a crucifixion setting, though I don't recall any imagery of crucifixion. I was screaming something like "There is no god," and woke up fearing that my parents might have heard my yelling that phrase.

I had several dreams of a nuclear bomb going off while people I knew watched with me. What made these dreams unusual was that they were in color.Also I was always standing afar off and watching the radiactive cloud rise in the mushroom shape and being so afraid because I knew we were going to all die. Being in the generation where I was taught how to act during a nuclear attack and drills were held in my school, I assume that was the reason I had these dreams.
Was scared by an alligator in the Everglades. A neon sign reading "Everglades" was in the dream, cooncidentally, the same as a sign on a lounge in my neighborhood.

that I was coming home from school (grade school... I was very young) and when I got to where my house should be it was gone... there was nothing but a barren plot of earth. I was under the impression that my house had "flown away". I felt isolated and alone and scared.
BEING IN SCHOOLL STAIRWELL - DARK HEAVY DRAPERY NEARBY - FELT SCARED BUT WASN'T HARMED.

I was ice skating and there was a hippopotamus in a tutu skating on the rink as well. (I'd recently seen "Fantasia") Whenever the hippo was opposite from me on the rink, the ice would tilt down and I would start to slide downward. I was pretty scared, both in the dream and out of it.
running up driveway trying to rescue somebody from some danger, legs moving very slow, can't ever get there

I remember a nightmare were I was sitting on the toilet and the wind was whistlying through great peaked rafters [our house was a stucco flt roofed one story--perhaps from my many books reading about witches and goblins?) Pluto was the name of a woman who was very buxom and somewhat resembled a comic character, but not the comic c=haracter with the name, and she ws coming to harm my mother. I was very scared. That is the oly fragment I can every remember.
standing on a big ball and a giant sewing needle coming straight at me, then reverse on needle with ball coming at me. then waking very frightened
I was sick with ear infections and sleeping fittfully. I dreamt I was being covered with a cloud that was very white and soft. Not frightening but interesting. The cloud was very comforting.
being chased at night by a bat and running down the middle of the street with my coat over my head,I'm still terrified of bats!

I dreamed often about the sounds of lots of people whispering from beneath my bed. I was always afraid to look, but knew that if I did, I wouldn't see them but they'd grab me and pull me under the bed.

Sitting in my preschool's reading circle, with a lion sitting next to me. IT was fine if I paid attention to the teacher, and not the lion, but if I looked at the lion he would roar and threaten to eat me.

Being in a field, and boulders are rolling towards me and making a lot of noise like an avalanche. Suddenly, I was in a regular room in a house and the furniture began to fall apart. The table legs gave out, and the table collapsed. I wanted to stop everything from falling down all around me. I woke up stressed out and scared.

Just the classic free-flying dream, where you take off from a swingset at keep flying, getting great aerial views accompanied by a vague dread, "How will I land!" The landing is alwas a soft bounce. . .

Dad was driving a black pickup truck on a country road at night. Black cats jumped out of the ditches and were yeowling, hissing and scratching all over the windows and doors, top and hood, in the back of the truck trying to get at us. We sat real still so we wouldn't irritate them. Then Dad turned a flashlight on, shining it out at the cats and they all went away. We continued on the road toward home but I sat closer to him, still scared of the cats and the noises they made.

I was standing in a barn near a large wood post that had metal electrical conduit with an outlet near the floor, and lightning struck the barn and traveled down the conduit to the ground at the base of the post. I was not hurt, but it scared the tar out of me. It was a repeating dream.
it was a dream about a walking tree from the old farmer and the mice cartoons. it scared the crap out of me
A repetitive nightmare of a prancing white stallion that frightened me awake. Nothing more than an image
I was in a clock facing danger at every turn. I was close to being crushed in the gears. Very vivid.
Flying, fearful that I could not control my height ... how to get down?
Shapes moving around, feeling threatening

Walking along a road on the side of a mountain--and looking down on to a lake. In the lake was a large dinosaur and it swam in the lake and seemed to follow me as i walked along. i was a bit afraid, but no overly so, since the creature could not reach me.

I was driving a car under a subway and pulled over to the right and went into a candy store, I asked the price of the candy when I left the store it was completely dark outside and when I walked over to my car someone with piercing eyes jumped out and ran. They was a arm on the dashboard of my car. Years later not in the dream, I found myself in the same area, almost got raped and was in danger.

It was the end of the world and I was watching the explotions of some very powerful bombs,from a savety distance.the agresive army was from China. I was very afraid and I was 7 years old.The colors of the explosions are still vivid in my head.

A hoard of bugs, mostly large, two inches to six inches, come scuttling from under my bed. Frightened, Iyell and jump up and down. The dream ends with me landing with my right foot's heel on the squishing adbomen of an ant-like bug about 6 inches long.
was in a giant concrete place, not underground, but bac kfrom the outside on the ground. it was very frightening. there were other kids there but no one to protect us. had the deam for 5 or 6 years
Lying in bed being afraid that someone could crawl up the wall of the house and get into my bedroom throught the window. A prowler breaking in

I dreamed that there were ghosts at the foot of my bed, eating bowls of oatmeal. It scared me, but they did not come any closer than they were, although they were looking at me and talking about me. I didn't know what they were saying, I just sensed that they were discussing me. I was very afraid and felt somewhat protected as long as I stayed huddled under my blankets, but able to see them.

I look out my second story bedroom window in early dawn. House is on corner wand pine trees frame the street below. I see a body lying in the street wearing a dark pink robe like my mother's. I actually wake up. It is early dawn and I am afraid to look out the window and have the dream become reality. I finally look and am relieved it has been a dream after all. No body.

I was terrified by a dream I had about a flying rocking horse. It was a normal childhood toy we had that for some reason became an evil thing in the dream. I thnk I was four or five when I had this particular nightmare.
A man was trying to catch me and i was so scared i would sleep with my mother and she made me feel better
I remember dreaming about a horror movie I seen. I was in a mansion upstairs looking down in a foyer with a checkered floor. Thats all I remember.
I was looking into a lily ponbd in a garden when an ape-like figure swam up toward me out of its depths. I was frightened and very glad to wake up.

I had a recurring pattern of a dream in which I was running, be it for sport or out of fear, in which I was able to only run faster if i knew I was dreaming and could therefore make myself run on all fours like an ape/gorilla.

I dreamt that two german shepards had came through my bedroom window on a hot summer night. I was about nine years old. The dogs stood on the bed above me and growled softly. I was not sure if they meant me harm or not. Even know it was summer I could see their breath as if it was very cold. I was so scared I could not move, I woke after wetting the bed.

Flying in an open cockpit WW1 era biplane, engaged in a dogfight. I eventually lost the battle and had to bail out of the plane at very high altitude without a parachute. My brother jumped out of his plane also sans parachute to show me that we could fly (without the planes) and were in no danger of falling.
i could fly from danger

It was either a dream in which I could fly, at will, by simply lifting up off of the ground and then flying, usually around a backyard tree. Or it was a dream of an unknown, but terrifying shape. I don't know what the shape represented but I was terrified of it.
I was in the back yard of my grandmother's house, and a red monster who lived under the steps frightened me.
Being at the beach under threat of large surf or tsunami about to occur.
Five devils (horns, tails, round bodies) about my size (age three?) dancing in a noisy circle in my bedroom. They weren't bothering me, but I was surprised and afraid anyway.

Was being watched by very large stone creatures that were up on a ledge in a cave. Was hiding under a beach towel. Father went up to the stone creatures to "fight" them. Was scared father would get hurt.

Being outside in the back yard and covered with lady bugs. Then switched to being in my bed covered with lady bugs. (This may be because there were painted lady bugs on the headboard of my bed at the time.) I was frightened but didn't want to be because I liked bugs. The bugs weren't biting, just crawling - and I was covered all over (like the tricks you sometimes see with bees -- "beard of bees"). I was probably 4 or 5 years old.
I remember dreaming about a ghost (in cartoon form, like Caspar) It was not frightening but it is a vivid memory

Don't know if this was the first dream, but had a recurring dream about flying and/or falling--I would be flying high in the air, and start falling (nervous, scared) and when I hit the ground I would bounce back up, and this repeated over and over in the dream--kind of cool, actually, but it felt out of control and very unnerving in the dream.
I dream I am in a city that only exists in my dreams. It still recurs, with different situations in each dream, but they are usually threatening.
afraid that hitler was hiding in closet in bedroom
I was on the starship Enterprise running through the halls in response to a red alert trying to get to the bridge. I eventually woke up and realized my alarm was going off to get me up for school.

When I was in kindergarten we were shown a Disney film that was supposed to educate us about getting smallpox vaccinations. The "germs" were big black spiders that were dropped from airplanes (this was during WW2). I had nightmares about finding spiders in odd places for weeks after that, and have been terrified of them all my life.
I remember being very frightened as these sort of robots were chasing me. They were made of metal with smooth cylindrical bodies and no face
it was 1943 I was 3 living in Brooklyn NY, my father who died in 1944 and there was a blackout and being frightened and my father carrying me my and aunt and uncled were also in the apartment
Itis raing. My unle who had recently died is at the windows,knocking on it to be let in, no one sees him (but me). I am terrified.

I was leaving a baptism and walking with a very very old man (whom I didn't know). He actually used an ear-trumpet. I said, politely, "Nice baptism." And he said, "Eh?" And I repeated a bit louder: "Nice baptism." And he again said, "Eh?" And when I said, very loudly and slowly, "It was a nice baptism, huh?", he took the ear trumpet out of his ear and blew in it like you might a conch shell at the beach and frightened me.

I remember flying by myself into a fog. This fog reminded me of a childhood B movie that I watched that scared me called the Crawling Eye. As I penetrated the fog I began to see the eye. I woke up screaming.
I was hiding in some bushes while a dinosaur was walking past. The dinosaur was searching for me and I was afraid it was going to see me in the bushes.

Dying in the Challenger crash. I didn't know it was the Challenger crash until later, since I wasn't born until later, but after watching the videos it was exactly the same as my dream. It wasn't frightening, it was more matter of fact attitude, since there wasn't anything I could do about it.
I only remember being scared.
I dreamt that I was being chased by an uknown being but I was never caught although I was very scared.

When I was about four or five years old,I remember a nightmare of being very afraid of the puppet, Howdy Doody. I felt threatened by the puppet. Then I remember grabbing some scissors that were on a beside table and began stabbing the puppet. I awoke very quickly when that happened.
lying in bed - sheer curtains blowing in the windows - someone else in the room - a lot of fear - blankets up to my neck
I dreamed that numberals were being written in the sky. It was a counting from 1-7 [one to seven]. When I woke up I was gripped with fear.

I was walking along a narrow path with my daughter after me. I did not see that there was a snake on the ground. My daughter who was behind me stepped on it. It was when I saw it also, because she cried with fear. My son was near. He came, hit the snake, killed it, and buried it.
And the following night scared that I would dream another dream, I did not sleep much. But praise God! With the short sleep, I dreamt I was in Heaven rejoicing.

I've had the same dream several times. I dream of going to Chainama Hospital [psychiatric hospital] and I see myself in the group of those crazy people. Two Catholic nuns come and kneel down and pray for me. I start shivering. I run home fast. I reach my bedroom and start praying. I wake up and become very afraid that I can't go back to sleep.

I know that lady who came to me and said, "Mr. Lungu, I know you are very stingy, you don't help us, you don't give this, you don't help this. Mr. Lungu I must tell you that I don't think your life is alright. Your life is in danger."
Weeks later the same dream came back. I heard just the voice, "You tell ______ to stop doing what he is doing." [Again I was afraid to go to him.]

I dreamed one night. I only heard a voice in Lamba. It said, "You go to ______ and tell him not to do what he is doing." Now this man was a deacon of my church. [But I did not know him very well. I was afraid to tell him about my dream.]
I find myself in dreams always praying and shivering. I feel fear in praying. And after that I start singing and I have fears again. I start trembling as if I'm possessed by demons.

I was crossing a big river but I was wondering how to get across. I saw a bridge. I go half-way across, then I return. I have fear going all the way across because I feel I may fall into the river. But I want to go on the other side. I do not know what is there. I'm afraid. I see only water. Much water. No land on the other side.

103. The terrible danger in which I had been in the night between the 29th and the 30th was afterwards represented to me in the sleep ; that I was upon a cake of ice which after a while could scarcely bear me ; further on I came to a fearful great abyss ; a person on the other side could not come to help me, and therefore I turned back.

101. This was a Sunday. Before I fell asleep I was in deep thoughts concerning the things on which I am engaged in writing. Then I was told : "Hold your tongue, or I will beat you." I then saw someone sitting on a block of ice, and T was frightened. I came as it were into a vision ; I held back the thoughts, and one of the usual tremors came over me.

100. I seemed to be walking across a field which was very rough. T had in my hand an iron staff which after a while was not heavy to walk with. I came to the end of the same field, and I lay on a bed. There came against me a very large black ox and it seemed he was going to gore me with his horns. I was afraid but it was said to me: "You will get through safely." I awoke.

91. I saw my father in a beautiful surplice before a con- gregation. He spoke to me in a friendly way, and wished to take me into an inner chamber where there was a person who seemed to be asleep, and to whom he wished to tell about me. I withdrew softly, being afraid of awakening him.

49. It seemed as if I were racing down a stairway; I touched each step only a little, and came safely down all the way without danger. There came a voice from my dear father, "You are making such a racket, Emanuel !" It was said he was angry, but it would pass over.

25. Two persons came; they entered a house which, though built, was not yet furnished ; they went about but did not seem favorable : we realized that our power was gone, and were afraid of them. One of them came to me and said that they intended to inflict a punishment on me the next Thursday before Easter, unless I made my escape. I did not know how to get out, but he told me he would show me the way. I awoke.

24. I stepped out of a carriage; it was driven into a lake. While driving into it the coachman cried to the other carriage to take care, as there was danger when he drove in ; I looked at the other carriage ; behind it there seemed to be a screen which was unfolded like an umbrella. I, together with the man who sat behind, took the screen, went in, and folded it together.

In my dream I was talking with one American lady. She was one of the Christian [ladies]. And I proposed her and she accepted, but by that time her pastor came and teased her as well as scolded her. At that moment she was so afraid, and I was looking for a chance to [move] away from her pastor, because I was also afraid of him.
I saw a horse in my dream. That horse was coming towards me. And God said to me, "Ride.” But I was afraid, terrified. Lastly, I refused to ride the horse and I woke up.

In my dream I went to a temple in Kathmandu. And there I was saying "In Jesus’ name, Satan get lost." One man accused me of being a Christian. That man was about 25 or 26. I had never seen him before. That man gathered the people and came to the Bible college. I was in college and I was afraid and also I was angry. But that man was like a drunkard and I bribed him using 2000 rupees and he left.

I saw a dream that I had gone to the bank of the big river. After that I saw a huge animal coming towards me from the forest and the forest was covered with snow. When I saw that huge animal I was afraid and I began to run away and that animal was chasing me. I come to village and I was saved and that animal went back to that forest. That animal had big ears, long tail, and small claws.

There were girls in a certain place and they were working. There were also boys and they were dangerous. When I reached the place, the boys started chasing me. I ran away. I reached the jungle and I was afraid. I was trying to say 'Hallelujah' but I was not able to.

I was in a village but the place was unknown and new to me. I was there with my big sister. And there was one stranger who was the landlord. He sent my sister to his farmland. We went there and worked. After irrigating the farm, as we were returning to his home, I was afraid and angry.
In my dream I do not see my body but I feel that my body is there. In the dream a dangerous animal chases me. It is very difficult for me to run.

I was in a large unknown jungle and I was alone. I saw an old man but I did not understand what he was asking of me. When I was still trying to speak with the old man, animals came and started chasing me. I was afraid and I fled from there and I do not know where I reached. I was very angry with the animals. I was so angry that I [wanted] to kill them.

I was driving a big bus. There was many children inside the bus. I felt like I was driving a school bus. At that moment I had driven bus on the highway. I was very confident. No fear was there. And I drove just for 5 minutes. I took that bus in the big playground. I did one round. Again I came to the same road. Thereafter, Krishna Dai was in the scooter. Krishna Dai said to me, “You don’t know how to drive the bus. Why did you drive?” Then I woke up.

In my dream I saw my dead maternal grandfather. In that dream I had gone to my maternal uncle’s house. My dead grandpa and [living] grandmother were staying [there]. My dead grandfather was cooking food to eat whereas my grandma was sitting in patio. I reached there and sat together with my grandma on the patio. But the strange thing is my grandpa did not speak with me nor did my grandma. Then, I woke up. I was afraid.

That dream was like this: last night all my NEHTS friends were in chapel. One fellowship was going on. And one “sister” [female member] has to lead. While she lead for that fellowship she prayed. After prayer my church’s “sister” was also in my dream. She was sitting with me. She started to [speak in tongues] but because of her tongue language I am so afraid. All [my] friends and teaching fellowship sister also became surprised.

I saw one dream in which my good [male] friend and I fought because other friends came in between us. Between us there was a bad misunderstanding so there was a big fight. The dream made me very afraid.

Last night I saw a bhut [ghost] coming before me in my dream. The ghost was wearing a white dress. I cried seeing that ghost. The ghost was in sari. It was not trying to scare me. I felt it was trying to say something. But I was afraid of ghosts, so I cried. Then I woke up.

I was inside some place like a room. Suddenly the light left and it became dark. Then in the dark it became a new place like a dark hill where there were no people. I looked from here to there and I couldn’t see anyone. I was alone. After some time this voice automatically [came]. It said, “I will eat you, I will kill you.” Then I saw one who was so terrible to see. [I was afraid.] I saw one person who was like animal [and] talking like man.
I am on a rooftop, a black man with a whistle on his neck, like a gym teacher appears, I am distracted by him and my son falls of the roof. I wake up in horror. the end
I am on an excursion, We are on a mountain top, my son falls of, I wake up in horror. the end

I get on an airplane, and everything seems to be going well. I am taking a flight somewhere. Suddenly, the airplane starts to plummet downward, and I know it will crash. I am inside when the airplane goes down, and I am afraid that we will all be killed. I am prepared for the worst. (But I wake up before it hits the ground.)

I am climbing a mountain with Jim Birdwell, one of the most famous American climbers. I am scared. But I look up and see that it is reasonable to climb the mountain. I say, "Jim, let's run right up." He says, "You'd better be careful. Looks can be deceiving." So we start out carefully and are successful in our climb.

I have a spider on my pajamas, and I am afraid it will bite me. Then my father has his arm around me, even though he died three years ago. We walk around the house where I grew up and down the street. An old grade school buddy appears, and he hugs me. It was a pleasant moment in contrast to the terrifying spider.

I go on a very strange shark fishing trip. I am wearing fishing gear, and hang on to a rope behind a rowboat with the leader pole in my other hand. At the end is the shark bait. My younger brother is in the boat. It was nighttime and I tell him he is too young to be fishing at night. But I realize that it is not dangerous, simply uncomfortable. I don't catch anything.

I am sitting on a badminton court of my childhood home. I am sitting in an Indian blanket wrapped around me on the ground. My former husband is approaching from the bottom of the hill. I am frightened.

I am with my daughter in a strange woman's house. It is on two levels. My daughter is in a crib, even though she is now grown. I see a red stretch of fire out of the window. This seems to be a radioactive wall and it is coming closer to the house. I snatch my daughter from the crib but there is no place to take her. I feel that it is Armageddon, and I am terrified.

The ground trembles. It is a shadowy place. I feel the vibration throughout my body. I'm terrified, thinking I will perish in the quake. The group opens and a huge monolith of obsidian rises slowly out of the earth. A reified sun is carved on one side. I am in awe. A single bell rings and I hear it.

I am in a house, sleeping. I have three female friends who live in a house behind me. They are separated from my house by one house. They are in danger and run from their house to mine. The two men in the middle house shoot at them. One woman is hit in the leg and falls. I am concerned that she has been left behind and is angry at my two other friends and me for leaving her. But they tell me they only want to go to sleep.

I am in a room in the upper floor of a house. It is dark. My grandmother tries to come in and I feel her presence. I am terrified because I do not want her to come in. I scream for my son. We arrive and we are successful in keeping my grandmother out of the room.

There is a man chasing me who wants to kill me. I have a gun, and I shoot him, but not fatally. I look back and see this man standing, trying to catch me by the leg. I send electricity from my hands. It cleaves his skull so that I can see his brain and his eyes fall out. I feel that he is still alive and will chase me until he finally drops dead. So I am still very scared.

Someone is chasing me. I run away, across a field. Whenever I wave my hand, this makes my pursuer stop and disappear for a while. Then I come to a medieval town and keep running on the streets of that town. I find the house of a witch, baba-yaga. I think she may have something that would help me. But I am afraid of her because she could betray me. Anyway, I follow her into her house and take a potion she gives me. It enables me to fly away.

I am walking down the street and see one man robbing another man. Then they kill him. They notice me and try to catch me so they can kill me. But I manage to escape. Then I come to a group of people who I do not know at all. We introduce ourselves to each other. It is late at night, but I can not get to sleep because I am afraid the two robbers will find me and kill me. But then I go to sleep. When I wake up, I go to the police and tell them everything.

I am at the Dneiper River or perhaps another great river or lake. There is a big hill of sand, and a tree on the bank. I and my two classmates climb over the tree on the top of the hill. My friends, both of them males, jump into the water. It is my turn now. I jump and when I reach the surface of the river, the depth turns out to be so shallow that in nearly covers my knees. But I am still scared. (I wake up scared.)

In this dream, I am running down a road. My mother is far in front of me. I keep running, trying to catch up with her. Then my mother turns around. She starts shooting her gun at me. She is aiming at me, and I think she is trying to kill me. I am scared. I am very terrified. (Then I woke up, still feeling scared.)

(dream within a dream) I wake up and see two green, luminous eyes on the wall. Then I see shadows, and a great black panther appears in the room. I get very frightened and run across the room. I hide behind the sofa. The panther follows me and tries to reach me with its claw. I think I wake up. But the panther is still after me. Then I really wake up.

This was a scary dream. I was alone on a street, in the world, in the whole universe. I roamed without a path, stumbling over logs and corpses. When I found myself at the edge of an abyss, I was terrified. I understood that I had to jump and be broken on the sharp stones. Something pushed me down. I resisted with my whole body. I didn't want to die. Suddenly, images of people I knew appeared out of the fog. I cried and an echo repeated my groans. It was the end and I had to jump.

In this dream, I am afraid of dying because my neighbors start to die, one by one. I think of what a short period of time it took for so many of them to die, both men and women. I would like to live a more spiritual life, but the conditions around me do not permit it, as I must work very hard each day. Then one of my dead neighbors comes to me and tells me that I can lead a spiritual life through my work.

I am at home with my mother-in-law. She sends me to dig up potatoes. I go out to the vegetable garden, take a look down, and see a ball of snakes. I get scared and call my mother-in-law. She tells me to throw the ball into the fire. I try to take them but they are slippery and slimy. Then I try to braid them, and I succeed. I throw the snakes into the store, but they crawl away and attack me.

This dream was emotionally colored. I had a feeling of discontent. I was in a room with a stranger, a man I had never met. The fire of his eyes reflected his wickedness. I saw a key in the door hole, but the man saw it first. It is strange, but he did not lock the door. In fact, he disappeared. Later he came in again, but was looking for someone else, and went out. My fear disappeared.

I was chased, taken prisoner, and placed in a castle. My younger brother came to the castle to help me out. But he was also taken prisoner and put into the jail cell with me. We were scared and we worried a lot about what would happen to us. Then our parents came to the castle and rescued both of us.

In this dream the weather is cold. Leaves fall on the ground. The sky turns gray and bleak. The river begins to cover with ice. I am with some other people and we are all frightened by this change of the weather. My father was with me, and told me he was fatally ill. He said he did not know if he could go with me. In fact, he plunged into the water and sank. I was not afraid. I did not pity him. I took his death as it was.

I took a train to visit my friend who lives in a small village. I had to walk from the railway station. There were two roads. I chose the one that goes through a garden. So here I was going on this road and suddenly I saw a tree. I went over to it, touched it, and the tree began to incline, and fell down. I got frightened by the thought that I would be blamed for breaking this tree and ran away.

My family and I decided to visit my mother--me, my husband, and our little son. My mother lives on the seventh floor of her apartment building. We all arrived and began our visit. Then, my son and I went out for a walk on her balcony and -- bang – my son fell from the balcony down on the pavement. I was scared. (I woke up in fear. I have had this dream twice.)

I am at my granny's house (she died some years ago). I approach a porch and open the door. It creaks. I recognize that creaking. Granny used to return home and night and I always waited for the creaking of the door as an end to my loneliness because I was afraid to stay home alone. So I am wandering in the house which consists only of one large room and I see granny. She is going along the river bank in my direction. And suddenly she disappears.

I see my kitchen garden in this dream. It is winter. Some seedlings I planted last fall are shooting sprouts out of the snow. I am looking at them and that is all I can do. There is a feeling of fear, unaccountable fear because I do not know the reason for it.

I am walking but suddenly I can't move. I try very hard. I strain myself trying to move my legs. I try to walk faster. It is all useless. It is all in vain, as if my feet are stuck in sand or quicksand. I feel helpless, irritated, angry, and frightened.

I am riding on a horse toward some destination quite far away. We have been having a very difficult ride through a dangerous road, and I feeling some fear and anxiety. I do not know if we made it safely to our destination. But the horse was very loyal to me and did not betray my trust.

(repetitive) (The content of the dream may be different, and the characters may be different but there is a recurrent episode.) I am going somewhere, but I can not move. I try again. I try to find support on the ground for my feel. I try to increase the pace. It is all in vain. My feet are as if they are stuck in something which gives way. I experience powerlessness. I am irritated, angry, and scared.

I enter a house that I have never been in before. It is ancient, dark, and gloomy. Suddenly a vampire appears, and then another one. Then monsters appear. It is like I am on the set of a horror movie, but I know this is serious business and I fear for my life.

I am about to have intercourse with a woman who is a stranger. She has a handkerchief over her face. I take the kerchief off and discover, much to my horror, that this woman is a witch. I lose all sexual desire, and try to escape the situation as quickly as I can.

I am in a labyrinth. I am walking along it, and there are many turns. I am afraid, but there is no reason for these fears. I know that I have to only walk forward and that I can not look back. So on continue on my quest unafraid.

I am in the Vietnam War as a solder. My battalion and I are walking in the jungle. Water is all around us, and I hear shots. I am on the American side, not the communist side, so the communist Viet Cong are shooting at us. We avoid the Viet Cong, but I am afraid of running into crocodiles. Those who are wounded disappear into the water, and I know the crocodiles have eaten them. I am afraid of being surrounded by the enemy or being eaten by the crocodiles.

(repetitive) From time to time I have a dream that I am in a dangerous situation. A man approaches me with a gun. He shoots me in the heart, and he runs away. I think I am dead, but am surprised to discover that I am still alive!

I am called up for army service in this dream. I am puzzled as to why I should be called up, as I have already completed my service. I am afraid that there has been some bureaucratic mix up and that I will have to go again. I fear for my life, as I may be involved in military action of some type.

I come to the apartment of my former wife. The furniture is rearranged, and some unfamiliar clothes are on my ex-wife's bed. I understand that I am not welcome here and will be turned out. Then I see myself in a spacesuit, as a cosmonaut. I'm launched into space by means of a contrivance resembling a boy's giant catapult. I am flying into cold, airless space, and I fear that my oxygen supply will run out and I'll be unable to return. I feel helpless and frightened.

I am with one of my former colleagues, a woman who is about45 years old. I do not like her. She is sitting to the left of me at a table and is slicing a red tomato. I know that she has been fired from her job, and I want to ask her about the circumstances. But I am afraid that she will turn on me with the knife, so I just leave her along.

There is a swing. I find myself on the swing. The swing is very wide and also very heavy. There is a cross piece. I make the full turn around the cross piece. I want to stop the motion but I cannot do it. I am very frightened when I can not stop the motion.

In my dream a black headless chicken is knocking against the window glass. There are bright blue skies in the background. Its blood flows in small streams along the class. Chicken's paws scratch the glass and slowly move to the open window. Mesmerized, I stare at it. I understand that I have to shut the window, and I can't move. I wake up with feelings of fear and frustration that my body does not obey me.

I am at home. Suddenly I find that there are snakes all around the next room. They are very beautiful but frightening. I close the door carefully. My son is playing in another room. I know that he likes to look at snakes in the zoo, but I can not let him into the room with these snakes. It is too dangerous.

I walk across the steppe. It is snowing. The wind blows from all sides. I am frightened. I hold my son, age five, by the hand, and feel some heavy burden in the other hand. I feel it is a child, but I do not see it. I look for my husband. I see the stream frozen and a small bridge across it. There is a large building on the other side. I know my husband is there. He is very ill. He dies before I can arrive.

I am being pursued by a snake. It moves as if flying on the air. I feel anxious. I escape. I meet my friend and sit in his car. The snake keeps pursuing us. I jump out of the car and see the snake's head falling off its body. I feel frightened. My heart beats heavily.

Standing at the top of some stairs and looking down, I see a strange boy who is hanging over the banister. When I am looking down, I am looking only at the top of his head. His head comes up very automatically, just like he is automated. He is looking at me, then his head stops very abruptly. He has this strange look in his eyes, like in a poltergeist movie or something. I wasn't scared. It was just like, "Ugh." He seemed not quite real.

I am at my sister's house and our Aunt Milly is there. Aunt Milly goes to the restroom and tries to put her makeup on. While she is gone, I notice a cat outside the house. I open the gate and the cat comes into the yard. some of the people in the house are scared of the cat. I am not afraid, so I go out to see the cat. But it falls into a petal-covered pond. I try to lift the cat out of the pond but it is a difficult task.

I was sitting in my desk at school when I realized that I had only one shoe on. I then knew that I had forgotten to put the other shoe on after the ball games I had been playing earlier. I was panicking about how I was going to leave the room to get my shoe, without anyone else finding out about it.

I am in an era where there are many dinosaurs. But they are small dinosaurs, not the type of dinosaurs that are large and threatening. I notice that some of the dinosaurs are dying, and suspect that soon they all will be dying out. This will be the end of one era and the beginning of a new era, with other forms of life. coming into being.

A strange man on a horse was chasing me. There was definitely an element of darkness about him. In fact, the whole dream had a very dangerous feeling. Suddenly, I was in a series of empty rooms all constructed from glass. There were various mirrors on the walls.

In this dream, a spirit is calling me to live a life of service. The spirit tells me that I need to work at the temple to learn how to help my neighbors. At first I am frightened of the spirit and her message, but then I feel very good inside. The spirit's message inspires me.

I begin to evolve with the environment, breathing with the atmosphere. I want to penetrate the earth and get closer to its nature as well. But I am afraid to contact the earth too directly, and so I keep my attention focused on the air and the atmosphere, as well as on my breathing.

I dream that I am flying. After a while, I notice that I am above a mountain, and am flying over a sea. But then I start to fall, and I am filled with fear. I fall very rapidly and am afraid that I will be killed when I hit the ground. There are many vivid colors in the dream.

I dream that I am in the room of a house. I open a window and see that there is a storm outside. It is dark outside and the wind is very strong. I run to find my daughter who is somewhere in the house, but I can not find her. I am afraid that she has left the house and is in the storm. I feel desperate.

I was with a pack of wolves. At first I felt a great deal of fear. Then I realized that they were my companions, and I felt no more dread. I could go to sleep and they would watch over me and protect me. I closed my eyes and felt quite secure and safe.

My cousin and I have just bought a car that has a white body with a dark top. I ask him if he is afraid that someone will steal this car. He says that he is frightened that this will happen. Then the scene changes to infancy where I am sleeping on a couch in the house. My brother is there too, and a boy who is a friend. I feel safe and secure there. But I feel that I have abandoned the car.

It is spring and I am passing by some trees. A man I know walks by with his pet. It is a fox terrier. The dog starts to bark. I am afraid that the dog will bite me. There is an old woman there, and the dog attacks her. But she stands firm. Then the dog barks at a young woman. She growls back at the dog and scares it. After that, the dog becomes friendly.

I am unable to move. I am stuck in a street. So I start to fly! I meet an electric wire but fly over it, so there is no shock. I am frightened. I think what if I had been electrocuted. I pass the wires and calm down. But then I leave the planet earth and go near Venus and by the moon. I do not know how to get back and I can see the moon very closely. But I do get back and come down to the street again.

I am with my daughter and we are by the water. We start to swim and go into the water deeper and deeper. We can no longer touch the bottom and I am afraid. I hope my daughter knows how to swim, because I do not swim very well, and she may need to save me. I am so filled with fear that I wake up.

I am in a strange house and my host, who is a stranger to me, tells me that the house is haunted. He is telling me that I have nothing to fear, and that the ghosts are friendly. They are spirits of people who used to live in the house, and they do not want to leave so soon. They know that someday they will have to leave so that they can go on to their next lives, but they are unwilling to go just yet. There is one man and two women among the ghosts.

I am in one place in nature but want to go to another place. I a mall alone, but want to be with people. I want to find a man and have sex. It will be very pleasurable, but it may also be dangerous. I see some lights in the distance and start walking toward them. There may be some humans there. Even if I can not have sex, I can have a good conversation with somebody. So I keep walking, and my anticipation is rising as I wake up.

I dreamed that the door of my house was opened by accident. I was afraid of what might happen and who might come in. The house in the dream was the house where I lived as a child, not the house where I live now. But the fear was strong, and it remained with me throughout the dream.

In this dream, I am preparing to tell a dream to a group. It is about a tower that is ten stories high. It is a hard, plastic tower. When I'm up in the tower, it begins to fall down. I'm afraid of what will happen and close my eyes. When I am in the middle of the fall, I open my eyes and see a way I can escape the tower. In fact, I lead many people to safety.

I am in a dark place. It is night and I am crossing a huge river. Some wood, perhaps large trees, appears to be floating on the water. I am afraid of that movement. I do cross the river, but I can not get rid of my anxiety. It is so dark that I am concerned for my safety.

A female friend of mine bought a small piece of meat and was prepared to guard it. I asked her why she needed so much security. In my hands, I found moths that threatened to spoil the meat, so then I knew why she had to guard it. So seeing the moths answered my own question.

I am with various men and women in an amusement park. It is a place to take rides that fly into the air. I enter the ride, but others are fearful and stay away. One man who is in charge of the ride offers me a place to sit and a safety belt. I accept the suggestion and fly very high. I feel an enormous sensation of good feeling while flying. It is a marvelous feeling, and I feel successful in this attempt and am glad I accepted the invitation.

I am in a natural environment walking hand-in-hand with a female friend. There are signs saying "Stop," "Prohibited," and "Danger." We continue to walk, and I step on to a poisonous thorn that injures my foot. I am afraid that I am going to die. But my friend brings my mother and my boy friend who rescue me. My boyfriend gives me a kiss and I feel much better.

I dreamed that I encountered a crazy man who was disfigured. He thought he was Napoleon and was imprisoned in a cage. I felt afraid that he would harm me, not physically but through what he would say. I covered his cage with a piece of grey cloth and turned off the lights so I would not have to see him.

I am in a place where I have to make decisions. My shoes are dirty. I look down and see that they are planted in the ground. If I leave the area, I will have to leave my shoes there because they are planted. There are three pieces of earth that I can transplant to another place. I am afraid to transplant them and move, but this is my destiny. I take one piece of earth and leave without my shoes.

I am in a school, but I am lost. I am studying chemistry. I do not know how to get out of the building. Then I discover an exit, and find myself outside. Then I see a lion. I am filled with fear. But I find an enormous watch, and this diverts the lion. Then the lion becomes calm.

I dreamed that I was on the beach with my mother. We were resting on a mattress. We saw some green snakes coming close to us. One of the snakes was a nagua -- the sacred snake that protected Buddha. It was mostly green with some red color on it. I did not feel fear; I was very impressed.

I dream of seeing the devil. I am frightened so call upon my angel. My lips are dry. I am alone but know my angel will protect me. There is nothing else I can do. I make an invocation but find it hard to speak out loud.

There is a hole and I descend into it. I see a primitive man. Is he an Indian? A cannibal? I do not know. I go by him into a clearing. There are trees with many leaves. I hear voices and see two tigers. I am frightened. I realize that I am the prey of the tigers and that they want to eat me.

I dreamed about a situation where I fought to stay alive. Someone had captured a group of people, and I was among the captives. We passed from house to house, and each time we moved there were fewer people because some of us had been exterminated. Suddenly, I was passing through water and I could see the powerful man who was conducting the murder of these people. I felt a great deal of fear.

I dream that a band of bats is flying around me. It is night. I know that to get out of trouble, I will have to fight them, and break the wings of some of these bats. But I am terrified of the bats and thought of having to fight with them.

(Recurring dream) I am in a place like a forest. In the shadow of an old building there is a well with its opening covered by spider webs. I am walking around the edge of the well. I am attracted by its darkness in the depth but the fear I feel keeps me from falling, and I just keep walking around and around the edge.

(Precognitive) I had a dream about a terrible accident. I saw a car smash into the window of an office building right in downtown Buenos Aires. I was afraid to look closely because I knew that many people were killed. So I sort of walked around the accident and did not look closely. I could hear the sirens of the police cars and knew that ambulances were coming. (A few days later, I read about such an accident in the newspaper.)

I dreamed that I was standing near an abandoned house made from bricks. In this house, there was danger, and it took the form of a burglar. I decided to attack him before he could attack me. Then I noticed he had a gun, so when I fought him, I took his gun away first. I knew he would try to kill me. I was frightened but I did get the gun away from him.

I was in a combat area, fighting the enemy. There were many enemy soldiers attacking our zone, and I kept shooting them down with my rifle. It was scary and I was terrified, but there was nothing else I could do. There were fortifications all around, some of them damaged and some of them still standing.

I am going to look for Roxana, my sweetheart during primary school. I am at a villa in the countryside outside of Buenos Aires, where there is a large house. I do not encounter her there, or in the inner hallways. So I go out. I am looking for a bus but don't see one. I ask a man and he gives me directions to an underground metro nearby. I feel danger. I am concerned about Roxana, so decide to look for her again, even though it is now night.

I was sitting on the edge of a lake and suddenly saw, in the reflection of the water, my head with spots on my face. I did not get frightened but tried to see myself again to be sure it was my face reflecting in the clean water of the lake. I went inside the water to observe myself, as if I was the reflection in the water that I had been seeing. When I did this, the spots on my face were no longer there.

I am in an apartment similar to one I used to occupy with my parents. There is a window similar to one where I lived as a student. It is night and I am able to turn on and turn off alight in my room. But there is another light that I am not able to turn off from here. I am afraid that thieves will use it to enter my apartment. I overcome my fear and leave by the window, which is now a door, and climb without weapons downstairs, leaving the residence because there is nothing there for me.

(I frequently dream that) I am falling straight down into a deep shaft or well. I start out walking along a street that seems very safe. Then, suddenly, the earth opens up and I start to all. I am very scared but there is nothing I can do to stop falling. And I can not see the bottom of the shaft.

I go downtown to do some business. When I have finished the task, I start to walk home, and then I find out that I forgot my address. I panic. I want to ask somebody, but it is of no use, because nobody knows where I have moved. Then I walk all evening and a friend of mine meets me, and takes me to my home.

I am leaving home. But there is a string tied on to my waist. The other end is tied to my house. It begins to unwind as I get further from my house. I am wondering that will happen as the string completely unwinds. I am afraid of the entire process.

I am in the kitchen of a humble house. On the table is a burning candle. It is the twilight hour, and I find two parts of chairs under the table, and the legs of my mother resting on the floor. I am afraid. Then I see that the rest of her is made of wax, and is at my side.

I find a house which seems to be a school for nuns, a convent. I see candles burning on tables inside. The Mother Superior is on the second floor. There is incense burning. The nuns are giving a Mass for a dead person. Suddenly I am all alone. I am in danger. I try to escape but the widows and doors are locked. But I do not give up. I know there must be more possibilities. I find a small window. I escape. Now I am safe.

I am outside. A man is chasing me, and I start to run. Then I feel as if I am paralyzed and can not run any faster. I look back at the man who is chasing me, but I can not see his face. Also, it is dusk and so vision is difficult. I am frightened because I know he wants to hurt me.

I am wandering on a road that runs through ocher dunes. The air is heavy and oppressive. I am alone, nostalgic, abandoned, and sad. I fear something. There is fog enveloping everything. There is little light. I am afraid of being attacked and raped before I reach my destination. I have lost something very important. It is my small car. I find it and am filled with joy. But will I be able to drive it back? I am suffocating from the reddish-ocher fog.

I was on a huge bed. I knew that on one side was my mother (who is actually dead). The bed was in a room without a wall. Instead, there was a great expanse of water. I knew that this was very profound. The bed and my mother had been put by the water to coerce me and to hurt me. But I was not afraid. I would be safe if I did not let my hand touch the water. There were other people at the side of the water.

I was on a beach. This beach was surrounded by an arena of some sort. Suddenly, I was surrounded by a sea with huge waves, like five-story buildings. I felt quite desperate. I was afraid I would be touched by the water. My fear preceded any contact with the waves themselves.

I dreamed that someone struck me and I felt as much fear as I was able to feel. This event had happened in my building, so I left it as quickly as I could. I felt that the building was under siege. And so I had no intention of returning there again.

I am in an elevator, generally with other people. When I want to use it, it begins to move and shake. I am in a panic--the elevator moves up or down at great velocity and I can't control it. (In one of the dreams) the elevator lost its walls and became a platform a moving platform, and started shaking. Finally, I am able to arrive (and the dream ended).

Woke up as I was signing a contract to move my production offshore in order to remain viable and competitive.

I was with several women discussing something around a table (perhaps a meeting/conference). One woman had white hair swept up in a bun. Around her collar bones an up her neck it looked like her skin was transparent -- you could see her arteries and veins -- but not in vivid color (blue & red), more like black and white patterns. I wasn't scared, just amazed. I don't remember anything else.

015 I am in Basic Training in the Army. A Drill Sergeant upbraids me. I beat and pummel him until he is dead. I go to Vietnam. I am with my old company but I am not accepted. I become a loner, an outcast. Roaming about, I shoot down American helicopters. At one point a Chinook lands and G.I.'s new to Vietnam come out and begin to march in single file. I shoot at them but instead of bullets only a spray of water falls on them.

021 I am in a large empty house. My brother and I are dressed as soldiers; we are hunting each other. I see him before he spots me and hit him with a burst of 16. I walk the bullets up to him. Curiously, they make only a small BB pattern and noise. There is little impact, little of the expected striking force. In any event, he goes down and I immediately rush to his aid. I feel very sorry for him and for what I have done.

025 I am trying to squeeze into a small English sports car. It keeps moving and I say, "Fuck You" to the driver. He returns and challenges me to a fight. We are in the garage of Bob's parents. I am full of confidence and cunning. Outmaneuvering the other fellow, I stab him in the back with a knife and say, "Give up or I'll kill you." He yields and I help him outside and dress his wounds.

045 I am witnessing the execution of individuals at close range. They are shot by men with rifles. They are in uniform and of the same race. They are Asian. There is very little sound or movement, no struggle or attempt to flee. The shot is fired, the body falls.
054 I am with a platoon of Israeli soldiers dressed as grunts. It is dark and raining, Everyone wears a poncho. We are climbing the rungs of a vertical tunnel. No one talks. We are going to war,

My first experience with the beginnings of an OBE. Fell into a catatonic, sleep paralysis state, as I have often. Reminded myself it's NOT a frightful experience or place and slowly calmed down. The thought of projection came to mind and immediately the vibrations throughout my body increased and i heard a low buzzing sound. I felt my feet begin to lift and at that point I freaked and woke up.

069 Dream 1: I am on a patrol with another American. We set up a perimeter and ambush site. We are in the jungle but it is, in fact, a large civilian park. I ask him for my M-16 because I cannot find it, but it is lost. He gives me my .45; he has the machine gun. In the morning, after an uneventful night, we head back to a car which will take us away. The car has been broken into. Items have been stolen. No one can be trusted.

071 Dream 3: Principles of Life are being explained to me by John Kraft or someone like him. I am told to think of life as a daily game, to imagine luck or good fortune. I agree, but question why this works, since it does.

074 Dream 2: I am in a wealthy environment, much like Clinic am Zurichburg, the Swiss mental institution where I spent two months in 1977. My family is present. Most prominent is my grandmother, who freely spends money, though she remains repressive and remote.

don't remember much, i remember being with some group of people in a house but can't remember specifics. then myself and 2 friends went to some amusement park in our neighborhood. there was a ride where you sit in a chair (like an office chair) and then the floor and chairs start spinning. i wouldn't go on it though because spinning makes me nauseous (it really does too). don't remember much else unfortunately.

I am in a building with my son Matt and I’m not sure what I am doing there except there seems to be some secrecy connected with my presence. Everything is relatively normal until we come to leave. A huge bulldog is guarding the exit and temporarily, we are stymied. Somehow, we manage to confuse the animal and exit the building. I wake up.

Dream revolved around me caring for a baby that was not mine. I am trying to protect him; feels like I am in a foreign country with horrible human rights issues. They would kill their babies and use bones for glue in a huge factory (possibly China?).

I am traveling with my father and younger sister. We stop to stay the night somewhere but my sister thinks I want to keep moving so she suggests we leave early. I protest: I need to take a shower; it’s at a public campsite. We end up staying another night.

Somehow I am sitting in the U.S. Supreme Court. I’m not sure what I am doing there. I seem to be a participant without much to say. For an ice-breaker everybody played ping-pong. I couldn’t even hit the ball. Priscilla was involved but participation is fuzzy. I decided not to go for dinner thinking my presence there with Harry (Priscilla’s new husband) would be tacky. I wake up.
All night my dreams revolve around Jewish people: being Jewish; in a Jewish community. Emotions: mad, frustrated, pissed off all night.

A professor of mine named Dr. Cho contacts me by telephone telling me that I’m failing his class for failure to turn in our final paper. I insist that I sent it to him over email. I’m looking at my transcript and the letter grades are scrambled. I just can’t believe that this is happening. I awoke relieved to have been dreaming.

A bunch of us are enclosed in a high fenced-in area. For some reason, the inmates start writing on each other’s jackets. I don’t care much for this game and resist participating. Actually, I become quite forceful in my avoidance tactics. I wake up.

I dreamt that I acquired angel wings. It was all so normal, as if we are all angels. I was doing everyday things on this Earth, but had huge beautiful muscular wings. The color took most of my attention: they were golden orange streaked, like a rose that has the petal tips stained white or pearl and streaked with golden orange which laced through the huge massive feathers. I remember looking over my shoulder and noting how massive and strong they were.
71. dream fragment - I have business cards covered with 3D material. Like the Zillow Website - things are 3D. I offer clients 3D comps. My co-workers doubt me, but I'm sure what I'm doing.

Scene takes place in a church. It seems that some persons are being accused of being pedophiles. I seem to be included among the accused. The way the community wants to deal with the pedophiles is to make them all sit in a special section of the church. I wake up.
I’m in the Army and I’m talking about my term in the army. The topic we are talking about is prayer. I am saying, “ when I was in the service prayer was important.” I wake up.
75. Fragment - getting my mailing list ready.

I am at my oldest sons school. I am going from classroom to classroom trying to get help for him. I’m pleading with the teachers to help. Can’t they see there is a problem with him? His grades have gone from 95 to 70’s and 60’s. No one wants to help me. As I go down the hall further, the doors are locked. I am angry and frustrated.

Only remember an evil angry female face; raging and ugly: white hair, mad look, very evil. Lot’s of anger in dream: the woman was mad, angry and vile. [This dream was the deciding factor to start serious therapy, Jungian]
76. A house we live in - people want to move in with us.

I remember thinking that I awoke suddenly and I was on a raft out in the middle of the lake. I can sense the smells and can hear the birds. I can see the sun peering through the cirrus-touched sky. I’m so tired I can barely move. Time seems to move quickly here in what I perceive as an hour, the sun visibly sinks and I’m under a glass moon. The water is completely calm now and I can feel myself fading out. The moonlight sounds like wind chimes on the water. That’s what I remember last.
Dreamed about being on a beach with waves. It was day time. Surfing or boogey-boarding was involved.
I am in a hospital. As far as I can tell, there is nothing wrong with me. However, for some reason I don’t understand, I am being held there under restraint. I wake up.

Nap dream: dream surrounded two friends of mine here in Fayetteville that were being selfish and uncaring. Another nap dream that my turquoise necklace broke on one strand. The pieces fell to the floor; I was able to save ¾ of the strand and was not too upset. I picked up the pieces I could find.

I am a naval officer aboard an aircraft carrier. On this day, we are celebrating an historic naval holiday and I have been selected to deliver the address to honor the occasion before the assembled crew. I have prepared for this presentation and deliver the address. I wake up.

In my dream, I am aware of a crime taking place. It happens on a lake. A person enters a small boat and proceeds to row out into the lake. However, the boat has been tampered with and slowly begins to sink. As my dream continues, I find myself getting into a small boat and as I begin rowing, across the water, I notice the boat is beginning to sink. I wake up.

79. I'm at the Watseka temple, but it's all different. Kyle is there and other people I have to work with. It's a project to clean out the old stuff - throw out junk from the corners. Stuff I thought about sorting out - I just throw it away. I see Kyle get in my car and drive it across the street and get mad. I think he's going off with someone else and get jealous. Some of the old matrons are there - I must check in with them or get their help to do my work.
80. Giving listing presentations, sending out notes.
Dreamed about my Grandmother’s house and all her possessions: who was getting what, all the stress and anger involved with my mom and her brother. Lots of anxiety.

There are 3 or four dogs but in the dream we called them snakes. They were tan and brown, very furry and soft. I don’t remember tails. I kept warning a friend of mine to stay clear of them because they will probably strike and bite. I felt that they were being sly, trying to lure us and then wrap around our legs to strike. The snake/dog would rub up against our legs and go through and around; acting very friendly. They never struck but I was very leery throughout dream.

81. In a play with some friends. It starts with a several page monologue and the woman who does it wants to run through it at every rehearsal, even though she knows it by heart. I want to ship it and just do the dialogue. I get mad and walk out - it burns everyone out because then we can't rehearse.

I am with six or seven guys. We have a friend who has a cottage on top of the hill and we decide to climb the hill and drop in on him. There are a few other houses on this hill. We begin the climb. Halfway up, I get separated from the group. I approach a house but become apprehensive and decide to retrace my steps. I wake up.

82. At Watseka, but not the temple, I fix dinner for a friend but she never comes home to eat. Later she comes home and I tell her there's some dinner. Later, time to go home from school, I get on a bus - it is actually a plane and flies. It does not go to Mulholland and Woodcliff though. The driver tells me which bus to take next time.
I am in a classroom with a group of religious education children. There are about twelve students in the group. The student seems to be a very vocal group which is getting on my nerves. I wake up.
83. something about being at a school, driving a car.
This is a pretty good size group and for such a sensitive issue (partial birth abortion). I didn’t notice the discussion getting out of hand or contentious. I wake up.
This dream was between myself and another person. We were writing poetry. I thought we were doing a rather good job. The poetry of my partner was quite picturesque and colorful. I wake up.

I wanted to go climbing at local gym. I get there and the guy asks if I have my gear. I can’t find anything; I look for my punch card so I won’t have to pay but can’t find that either. There are others with me, and I know I’ll have to pay for them all. He is doing my paperwork and getting rental gear when I notice my climbing shoes in bottom of huge duffle bad. I start finding everything and am relieved, thinking: I had it all along-thank goodness!

84. At a college - two colleges next door to each other. In the auditorium of the girls' college they do some ceremonies, then send us to the auditorium next door for the boys' ceremonies. They want us to not do anything - let them do the things. They have special chants, etc. In another part, putting things in the MLS - the subscription is $$ very expensive.

A large number of people are in a very large room. I become aware of many high level government officials. We had been asked to dress appropriately. For some reason, I had locked the doors to the hall so when the attendees began to arrive, I had to rush to unlock the doors.
85. Walking around, taking listings in neighborhoods.

I am with my mom and stepfather. We are at our old house in F. It’s late at night and very windy. My step-dad gives me a strange looking candle, it’s not regular wax but a fatty-almost lard or greasy substance with a wick. He gives me a strange lighter with a tongue like stick that heats up when lit. I had a hard time lighting the candle; it would light and then go out. I tried many times to light it. The house was huge and dark, we all had candles.
87. vague now - I go visit a family that needs to move.
I am with a group of students. We are on a winding country road and are supposed to take a test. Each of us find a comfortable spot on the side of the road and we take our test. I wake up.
I am in the army, state side. We have been assigned to meet as a group to discuss some major army issues. I wake up.
Dreamed of people made of lead or another metal/gemstone: colors were all the same, either of red or dark brown.

I am walking outside. Dogs are barking. They are getting closer. One of the dogs comes after me. I take off one of my shoes and tried to keep the dog at bay by swinging my shoe at the animal. I wake up.
90. Vague now, but I remember showing listings to people..
